results.title: American psycho [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mary Harron, Edward Pressman and Columbia Tristar
results.brief_description: Patrick Bateman (Christian Bale) is a highly successful Wall street businessman. He is a prime example of the opulence that flourished during the excessive consumerism of the 1980’s. Everything has its place and there is a place for everything, everything that is except Patrick’s mental stability. Call it a nervous breakdown or psychosis, his soul is simply not there. Combining horror, suspense and extremely dry satire, “American Psycho” is a meditation on excess and the loss of personal identity. Considering the controversial nature of Bret Easton Ellis’s novel, director Mary Harron and co-script writer Guinevere Turner have transliterated the work with remarkable wit and insight. The film maintains the ambiguous balance between what may be a horrific reality or an elaborate fantasy of a desperately lost soul. Cast also includes Willem Dafoe, Jared Leto, Chloe Sevigny and Reese Witherspoon.

results.title: American gigolo
results.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Jerry Bruckheimer, Paramount Pictures and Pierre Associates
results.brief_description: Julian Kay is a suave, confident gigolo working for upper class older women in the LA area. Materialistic and refined Julian likes to think that he is above the seedy milieu of johns and blackmailers that inhabit his world. One night he is hired to service a woman whilst her husband watches - when she turns up dead shortly afterwards, Julian is suspected of murder. Meanwhile, Julian has become involved with Michelle Stratton, a beautiful woman unhappily married to a local senator. Michelle, who doesn’t pay for his services, is drawn to Julian, despite his occupation and seeks to assist him with his dilemma. This film in part addresses the sexual frustrations of middle-aged housewives whose husbands bore them and neglect their needs. But mostly it is an erotic thriller and a paean to the early 1980s - the clothes, music, cars and pre-AIDS hedonism. Directed by Paul Schrader (Cat people, Light sleeper, Affliction), “American gigolo” made a star of Richard Gere and was an early hit for Jerry Bruckheimer who went on to produce “Flashdance,” “Beverly Hills cop,” “Top gun” and “Pearl Harbour,” among others. Cast also includes Lauren Hutton, Hector Elizondo, Nina Van Pallandt.

results.title: Alphaville
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Andre Michelin, Pathe Films and Athos Film
results.brief_description: A secret agent, posing as a journalist, from the ‘the world without’, penetrates ‘the world within’ - Alphaville. In his version of a futuristic dystopia, Jean-Luc Godard embraces a tech-noir aesthetic where human beings have become robotic slaves to technology, deprived of individuality and independent thought. In “Alphaville” the hero, played by Eddie Constantine with an embittered edge, evoking the ghost of Philipe Marlowe, has a mission to eliminate an eminent professor, the inventor of Alpha 60, a superior computer that governs society. The professor’s daughter, Natasha, played with an alluringly demure sensuality by Anna Karina, is the detective’s guide and also his love interest as he negotiates the bizarre, totalitarian state. Godard’s narrative is littered with numerous references, in particular, Aldous Huxley’s “Brave New World” and George Orwell’s “1984”. Godard uses the modernist 1960 Paris aesthetic to great effect, succeeding in presenting the city as a glimmering, ominous prison, where absurd and inhumane policies intermingle. Several memorable sequences include a firing squad - a cultural performance, accompanied by elegant water ballet sequences - that is witnessed by an admiring audience. An unusual addition to the canon of French New Wave cinema. Glorious black and white cinematography by Raoul Coutard. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman and Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: All about Eve
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Possibly one of the wittiest and sophisticated films ever made by Hollywood, “All About Eve” is a bitchy and sharp comedy about the jealousies and rivalries of theatrical life. Bette Davis, in one of her greatest performances, is Margo Channing, a self-obsessed, driven and committed actress who is shadowed and wooed by an aspiring starlet, Eve Harrington (Anne Baxter). However, the shy Eve is not as naive as she appears and by the end of the film she is moving to replace Margo and the poisonous cycle of ego and ambition is about to repeat itself. Wonderful adult dialogue, great direction and a cast of excellent supporting actors at their peak (George Sanders, Thelma Ritter, Celeste Holm) makes this movie one of the most entertaining ever produced. Watch out for Marilyn Monroe in an early cameo. Winner of six Academy Awards including Best Picture. Costumes by Edith Head. When they talk about the Golden Years of Hollywood this is one of the films to which they refer.

results.title: Aliens (Captioned) (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Gale Anne Hurd, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Brandywine Productions and James Cameron
results.brief_description: The Alien, the perfect organism. A killing machine whose physical excellence is matched only by its hostility. Officer Ellen Ripley and the crew of the starship Nostromo encountered such a creature and she alone survived the massacre. After floating in space for years Ripley is rescued only to learn that she must return to the planet where her nightmare began. L.V. 426, the world where Ripley first encountered the Alien is now colonised. When communication is lost with the settlers, a team of battle hardened space marines is sent with Ripley and find not one creature, but thousands. The Alien is breeding, and this time it’s all-out war! This special edition is a version of “Aliens” which contains 17 minutes of extra footage restored to the original by the director, James Cameron. Cast includes Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn and Paul Reiser.

results.title: Alien 3
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Walter Hill, David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Continuing the “Alien” trilogy, Ripley’s spaceship crash lands into a maximum security work correctional facility, a monastic community, host to some of the most violent criminals in the universe -but she didn’t come alone. Once again Officer Ripley is pitted against her deadliest enemy, only this time without the aid of advanced technology or modern weapons. This video also contains a 26 minute documentary called “The Making of Alien Resurrection”, which is actually the next film in the “series” after “Alien 3”.

results.title: Alfredo Alfredo
results.creator_credit: Pietro Germi, Gugliemo Colonna and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Alfredo Alfredo is a side-splitting comedy about the trials and tribulations of marriage. Alfredo Sbisa (Dustin Hoffman) is a shy young bank clerk who stumbles into a relationship with the girl of his dreams, Maria Rosa. His dreams take on a surreal tone as he is drawn deeper into a relationship with her. Who is this infathomable woman he has married? Alfredo starts to dream of an escape. Pietro Germi cleverly uses Hoffman’s gift for physical comedy, minimising his dialogue (which is dubbed by Ferruccio Amendola). In Italian with english subtitles.

results.title: After hours
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Robert F. Colesberry, Griffin Dunne, Amy Robinson and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Computer expert Paul Hackett accidentally stumbles into an all-night adventure through the rain-soaked streets of SoHo, Manhattan, when a chance evening encounter with a beautiful girl goes wrong. It all begins when his money flies out of a taxi and gets progressively worse from there, as he is led through a nightmarish chain of events. Eventually, his troubles become so horrible and convoluted that it seems he has wandered into a secret antechamber of Hell. All he wants is to get home, but events conspire against him in an hilariously appalling fashion. This nerve-wracking, blackly comic, paranoid nightmare is among Scorsese’s most entertaining and overlooked films. Cast includes Griffin Dunne, Rosanna Arquette, Verna Bloom, Teri Garr, John Heard, Cheech & Chong and a special appearance by Martin Scorsese.
